intro: Joniris ruthenica, commonly known as the Ruthenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its showy blue or violet flowers bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. Joniris ruthenica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
